intro: Pedicularis nipponica, commonly known as the Japanese lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Japan. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its spurred flowers, which are typically pink or purple in color. It grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Due to its specialized habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
